entries.name: ALLEGIANCE OF THE DÚNEDAIN
entries.description: Your allegiance lies with the Rangers of the North and their secret vigil over Eriador.

entries.name: BOLD
entries.description: You trust your capabilities to the point that you are not easily daunted, readily placing yourself in danger.

entries.name: BREE-BLOOD
entries.description: The folk of Bree are a rare mingling of Men and Hobbits, accustomed to strangers and old tales.

entries.name: BURGLARY
entries.description: You have a talent for stealthy intrusion and for finding ways past locks, bars, and guarded thresholds.

entries.name: CUNNING
entries.description: Your wit is sharp, and you are ready to use it to your advantage.

entries.name: EAGER
entries.description: You are filled with excitement and impatience when an endeavour piques your interest.

entries.name: ELVEN-SKILL
entries.description: The Elves of Lindon are gifted with arts and grace beyond the reach of mortals.

entries.name: ENEMY-LORE
entries.description: Enemy-lore is not a single Distinctive Feature; you must select the type of enemies it applies to (Evil Men, Orcs, Spiders, Trolls, Wargs, or Undead). This feature gives you knowledge of the characteristics, habits, strengths, and weaknesses of your chosen enemy.

entries.name: FAIR
entries.description: You are considered attractive by most people, even by those not belonging to your folk.

entries.name: FAIR-SPOKEN
entries.description: Your speech and manners are naturally pleasant and respectful, and your words rarely provoke offense.

entries.name: FAITHFUL
entries.description: You are steadfastly devoted to those ideals or individuals you have chosen to follow, and your unwavering loyalty often supports you in your deeds.

entries.name: FIERCE
entries.description: When provoked, or when you deem it necessary, you may allow your savage side to emerge.

entries.name: FOLK-LORE
entries.description: You are well-versed in the ways of the Free Peoples, and can quickly learn what is customary and what is suspicious.

entries.name: GENEROUS
entries.description: You give with open hands and heart, always mindful of the needs of others.

entries.name: HALFLINGS
entries.description: Halflings are small and often overlooked, but their courage and resilience should not be underestimated.

entries.name: HOBBIT-SENSE
entries.description: Hobbits possess a surprising knack for staying out of trouble — and for sensing it coming.

entries.name: HONOURABLE
entries.description: You believe in acting fairly and doing what is morally right.

entries.name: INQUISITIVE
entries.description: Your curious nature is easily aroused, often by what is often not your concern. The positive side is that you are not easily deceived by appearances.

entries.name: KEEN-EYED
entries.description: The keenness of your eyesight surpasses that of most folk.

entries.name: KINGS OF MEN
entries.description: The Dúnedain of the North are descended from the Kings of Men, and carry that legacy in their bearing and endurance.

entries.name: LEADERSHIP
entries.description: You possess the ability to direct others to action. When under pressure, other people naturally turn to you for guidance.

entries.name: LORDLY
entries.description: Your dignified bearing arouses feelings of reverence and respect in onlookers.

entries.name: MERRY
entries.description: Your spirit is not easily discouraged, and you can find light in the darkest of shadows.

entries.name: NAUGRIM
entries.description: The Dwarves are called Naugrim, 'the Stunted People'. This reflects their hard life and their people's customs.

entries.name: PATIENT
entries.description: You are slow to lose your temper and can suffer fools, delays, or even hardship without complaint.

entries.name: PROUD
entries.description: You hold your feats and achievements, or those of your people, in high esteem.

entries.name: REDOUBTABLE
entries.description: The Dwarves of Durin's Folk are renowned for their hardy spirit and stubborn resilience.

entries.name: RHYMES OF LORE
entries.description: You have learned much by song and rhyme, and can recall old tales and fragments of knowledge when needed.

entries.name: RUSTIC
entries.description: Your ways are simple, some might say even uncouth, but you know that not all that is gold does necessarily glitter.

entries.name: SECRETIVE
entries.description: You do not easily share your thoughts and prefer to conceal your intentions from the eyes of others, especially outsiders to your folk.

entries.name: SHADOW-LORE
entries.description: You have studied the Enemy and its servants, and can recognise signs of Shadow where others might miss them.

entries.name: SKIN-CHANGER
entries.description: Some Beornings carry the gift — or burden — of the Skin-changer.

entries.name: STERN
entries.description: You possess a severe nature and express it in your behaviour, body language, and speech.

entries.name: STOUT-HEARTED
entries.description:
Stories tell that the Bardings lived under the shadow of a great Dragon for decades.

Your VALOUR rolls are Favoured.

entries.name: STRIDER
entries.description:
NEW DISTINCTIVE FEATURE: STRIDER
Wandering the wilds of Middle-earth
alone hardens the spirit
and sharpens the senses as you are forced to remain ever-watchful
for perils in the periphery. Solo Player-heroes
receive
an extra Distinctive Feature: Strider. While journeying, the
Player-hero
is considered Inspired on skill rolls.

entries.name: SUBTLE
entries.description: You may not be a Wizard, but often the ways you choose to achieve your goals are crafty, if not devious.

entries.name: SWIFT
entries.description: You move swiftly and are quick to take action.

entries.name: TALL
entries.description: You tower above most of your folk.

entries.name: THE LONG DEFEAT
entries.description: The Eldar know that their fate is to fight the Shadow through the ages — a struggle they name 'the Long Defeat'.

entries.name: TRUE-HEARTED
entries.description: You are sincere, and your words and actions show your honest intentions.

entries.name: WARY
entries.description: You are always mindful of your surroundings and observant of the speech and behaviour of strangers.

entries.name: WILFUL
